member.summary: The class represents a single listener, endpoint configuration element.

remarks.para: The can be configured from code or by usage of the application configuration file and predefined configuration sections.
The represents the lowest level configuration element under which a single listener, endpoint is configured.

Check documentation of individual properties for the for details about meaning of configuration attributes on the listener node. See the for configuration samples and description of the service itself.

member.name: P:Volvo.NVS.Integration.WindowsServices.Config.ListenerElement.Listener
member.summary: A unique name of the listener and integration channel to be used.

remarks.para: A name of the listener must be unique among all the defined listener names in the configuration of the integartion.

The name of the listener specifies a name of the channel which is expected to be configured in the Integration library. For example: if you put "my_queue1" as the name of the listener then you must also have the "my_queue1" configured as one of the channels in the configuration of the Integration Library.
The name of the listener is also used as the name of the when the service, handler is not given.

member.name: P:Volvo.NVS.Integration.WindowsServices.Config.ListenerElement.Service
member.summary: A name of the unity registration pointing at the integration handler to be used.

remarks.para: The service name is the name of the unity registration. This registration must point at the implementation of the which will be used to process messages and to receive all the information about integration channel state changes.
The name of the service is optional. When not specified the is used as the service name.

member.name: P:Volvo.NVS.Integration.WindowsServices.Config.ListenerElement.DownTimeWarning
member.summary: A time after which the warning event should be raised when an integration channel is offline.

A warning is raised when a channel is offline and a specified time has been reached.

member.name: P:Volvo.NVS.Integration.WindowsServices.Config.ListenerElement.Start

remarks.para: By default the service subscribes into the channel when a service is started. When the is set to false this automated subscription is disabled. In that case a developer must subscribe into the channel manually in order to make it active.

member.name: T:Volvo.NVS.Integration.WindowsServices.Proxies.ChannelProxyMonitoringEvent
member.summary: The class traces event states, calculates event execution time and raises events for the .

remarks.para: The determines when a monitoring event should be raised and raises such event if that is necessary and the waiting (requested) time has elapsed.

The is created with the time after which an event should be raised. In order to raise an event the must be executed. The method calls the given delegate when an event should be raised or returns the time which the caller should wait for an event to be created.

Once the event is raised the event handler delegate return a value of type . When true is returned an event is treated as handled and no new events are created until the method is called. When false is returned we start waiting for an event from the beginning. The procedure repeats until true is returned from the event handler method (until an event is marked as handled).
It is up to the caller to execute the method as many times as needed. The does not contain any execution loop or thread. It is only responsible for time calculation and event handler execution.
See the for details.

member.summary: A time for which we should wait until an event is raised.

member.summary: A timestamp marking a point on the timeline at which the event has been raised for the last time. This is also the starting point from which the elapsed time should be calculated.

member.name: F:Volvo.NVS.Integration.WindowsServices.Proxies.ChannelProxyMonitoringEvent.created
member.summary: A flag telling if the event has been raised for the currently traced and calculated time.

member.summary: The synchronization object used to provide thread safety and ensure that operations are atomic.

member.name: T:Volvo.NVS.Integration.WindowsServices.Proxies.ChannelProxy
member.summary: The proxy class wrapping access into the , extending the channel creation and message handling capabilities as well as adding channel monitoring features.

remarks.para: The delegates message handling and all events into the provided implementation of the interface.
The channel object wrapped by the is created from the implementation. The channel is created when it is needed for the first time, on the first subscription into the channel.
The method starts the subscription on the channel so all the detected events are dispatched into the . Once the subscription is stared the channel will try to connect and go into the state.
The subscription can be stopped at any time by a call into the method. Once the subscription is stopped the channel state changes into the . A closed channel can be subscribed again at any time.

When a channel is in the state it may go into the state. A channel is disconnected when it is active but it is not able to communicate. It is different from the state under which a channel is not active and it is not even trying to communicate (is not trying to process any messages).

Once the channel is subscribed a monitoring of the channel is started. The channel monitoring detects disconnected states of a channel and all its closed states. It means it detects all types of off-line channel states. The monitor measures the time under which the channel is off-line. When the time exceeds the provided warning or error time the warning and error notifications are produced and the implementation of the is notified.

The monitoring of a channel is not stopped when the channel goes into the state. The closed channel is recognized and treated as being in the off-line state and the handler is warned about such closed channels.

Frequent changes of channel statuses may result in only single execution of the monitoring event handler method. For example: a quick change from to and then back to while the monitoring event handler is already executing on the first disconnection signal may only result in the completion of the currently executing event handler. This is especially true when an event handler returns true saying that an event has been handled. See also the interface.
All public method of the are thread safe.

member.name: M:Volvo.NVS.Integration.WindowsServices.Proxies.ChannelProxy.Subscribe
member.summary: Subscribes into the channel so processing of messages is started.

remarks.para: The complete subscription process is realized on a new thread so the method requests the subscription and returns while the subscription activity is still running. The current state of the channel and the state of the subscription itself can be verified by usage of the property.
The method creates the channel using the provided implementation of the object. Once the channel is established the subscription is kicked off.
When the subscription is started all the detected channel changes (status changes, arrival of new messages) are bypassed into the provided implementation of the .
The state of the channel changes into when the method is executed.
Only a channel in state can be subscribed. Any attempts to start a subscription on a channel being in a different state are ignored and the method returns without performing any actions.
The method is guaranteed to be thread safe.

member.name: M:Volvo.NVS.Integration.WindowsServices.Proxies.ChannelProxy.Close
member.summary: Closes the current channel.

remarks.para: The method closes the current channel stopping the subscription if that one is active. The is disposed and all the event handlers and resources are released.
The states of the channel is set into the when the method is completed. A closed channel can be subscribed again at any time by usage of the method.

member.name: T:Volvo.NVS.Integration.WindowsServices.Proxies.ChannelProxyMonitoring
member.summary: The class monitors activities of the which is managed by the .

remarks.para: This monitoring class observes changes of the and generates messages for the channel being in the or states.
The time in which the channel is in the off-line state is measured. The monitoring messages are raised if and only if the requested message creation time is exceeded.
The implementation of the receives notification of the error and warning messages raised by this class. The and the methods are called.

The event handler methods defined on the implementation of the interface may return value of type . This value tells if the problem has been resolved. When a problem is resolved the message is not raised again for the current channel state. When the problem is not marked as resolved the event is raised again in the defined event time.

It means when the event handling method returns false the event is always repeated until the channel is connected (problem solved, event handler says the event is handled). When the handler method returns true the event raising and time calculation is stopped until the next incorrect channel state is detected.
When channel becomes connected the complete monitoring procedure is reseted.

Frequent changes of channel statuses may result in only single execution of the event handler method. For example: a quick change from to and then back to while the event handler is already executing on the first disconnection signal will only result in the completion of the currently executing event handler. This is especially true when an event handler returns true saying that an event has been handled.

member.summary: Defines a contract for an integration listener handler.

remarks.para: An integration listener handler receives all the messages and notifications from the channel for which it is setup. You create the handler when you want to subscribe for messages and you are using the or the .
Every handler class must implement the .
In most of the situations a single handler is created and defined for a single channel or a single message.

The handler must be registered within the unity when a default configuration based on the application configuration file is used for the integration service. The code based configuration is also possible.
Check the for details.

member.name: T:Volvo.NVS.Integration.WindowsServices.Services.IIntegrationListenerMonitoringHandler
member.summary: Defines a contract for the handler with the channel state monitoring capabilities.

remarks.para: The defines methods called when the channel is down and a monitoring of a channel state is turned on. The monitoring of the channel state is initialized and run by the class. Warning or error messages can be produced when incorrect channel states are detected and a defined event time has passed.
Two event handler methods are defined: and the .

Every event handle method returns a value of type . When true is returned by the handler method the monitoring service treats the detected problem as handled and the event method will not be called again for the current channel state. When false is returned the monitoring service treats the detected problem as not handled. The waiting procedure is restarted and the event handling method will be called again according to the defined event time.

It means when the event handling method returns false the event is always repeated until the channel is connected. When the handler method returns true the event handling method is called only once for the detected incorrect channel state.
When channel becomes connected the complete monitoring procedure is reseted and result from previous calls into the event handler method has no influence on a new monitoring session.

Frequent changes of channel statuses may result in only single execution of the monitoring event handler method. For example: a quick change from to and then back to while the monitoring event handler is already executing on the first disconnection signal may only result in the completion of the currently executing event handler. This is especially true when an event handler returns true saying that an event has been handled.
Check also the for details and the .

member.name: M:Volvo.NVS.Integration.WindowsServices.Services.IIntegrationListenerMonitoringHandler.OnListenerDownTimeWarning(Volvo.NVS.Integration.WindowsServices.Proxies.IOperativeChannelProxy)
member.summary: Executes when a channel is down and a maximum down warning time is exceeded.
member.param: The channel for which the event is raised.
member.returns: True if the problem has been solved and the warning should not be created on more time for the current channel state. False if the problem has not been solved and the warning should be created again as defined on the warning waiting time.

member.name: T:Volvo.NVS.Integration.WindowsServices.Services.IntegrationListenerService
member.summary: The class provides behaviour for the which manages and subscribes the collection of integration channels.

remarks.para: The class enables simplified creation of Windows Services. When the is used the logic executed as the windows service logic should be provided by the implementation of the .
The class provides a logic for the . This class implements the . The manages the collection of integration channels and enables subscription and other operations on those channels.
The channel used by the is represented by the implementation. The wraps an and provides functionality required and used by the service class.

We use the to have a service (e.g. windows service) managing the collection of integration channels. This class provides the out of the box functionality which is specific and required by the service itself (e.g. stop, start).

By default the initializes the list of integration channels to be managed according to the configuration in the current application configuration file. When this default approach is used the following can be used to configure the integration service behaviour (we start by defining the configuration section for the integration listener service):

When a section is added we need to specify its configuration. By this we define the channels (listeners) which should be managed by the service. Every listener node tells what is the channel from the integration library to be used and what is the service (message handler object) to be involved when messages arrive or channel changes its state. Additional attributes are possible. For example the following can be defined:
remarks.code: <integration.config> <listeners> <add listener="my_queue1" service="ListenerService1" downtimewarning="00:00:10" downtimeerror="00:00:25" start="true" /> <add listener="my_queue2" service="ListenerService2" start="true" /> </listeners> </integration.config> <![CDATA[
remarks.para: For detailed documentation about the configuration attributes no the single listener level check the class.

A name of the listener is required and must be unique among all the other listener names. Additional attributes can be specified such as time after which a warning or error message is produced when a channel is offline. A flag telling if a channel listener should be started automatically is also possible.

The service attribute specifies a name of the unity registration which should be used as the channel message handler. Such an registration must point at the class implementing the interface. This is the implementation which will be used to process all the messages and detected channel changes (e.g. channel state changes). This implementation should be provided for every channel and it is implementation specific for your application. It is recommended to create a single handler per channel or even per message.
When the service attribute is not given the listener name is used as the service name. In such a case a name of the handler unity registration is the same as the name of the listener.

When all listeners are defined a corresponding configuration of the integration library is a must. A listener attribute specifies what is the name of the channel defined in the Integration Library configuration. The configuration of integration library is required and all channels specified on the listener nodes must be configured in integration. For example in our sample the following section is added:

The integration section must configure all channels for all listeners. The name of the channel must be the same as the name of the listener. In our sample the following configuration can be specified:
As we have defined my_queue1 and my_queue2 listeners under the integration.config we must also given the same for the volvo.nvs.integration. The channel names are the same as name of the listeners.

The can also be fully configured from code. For this the constructor taking an instance of the can be used. In such a case it is up to the implementation of the to provide the configuration and initialization of the objects.
When the is configured the must be told to use the integration related class the logic for the windows service. Check the for details.

member.name: T:Volvo.NVS.Integration.WindowsServices.Services.ReliableListenerHandler
member.summary: The class provides a base implementation for reliable integration listener handlers. A reliable listener handler has extended error handling capabilities. It is able to close a channel when application problems are detected as well as open the channel back when issues are solved.

remarks.para: The class takes the value in the constructor. This value specifies the time after which a channel being in the offline, disconnected state can be closed. Closing a channel helps in the resolution of major network related issues as the channel is fully restarted (closed and then opened back). It improves the channel reliability.

The provided value in the must be a non-zero, positive value. The value should also be tuned so it is possible for a channel to connect within a given time. As the given specifies a time after which the channel can be closed it is also the time after which an attempt for a connection will be terminated. It is because the connecting channel is treated as still being in the offline state so all connection attempts can be terminated after provided time into the .

The channel will only be automatically closed and opened back when the channel monitoring is enabled. The must be specified and configured. When the is not set the complete logic given by the class will have no effect on the channel and no automated closure and opening will be functioning.
The time given in the is not the exact time after which the channel will be closed. It is the time which must be exceeded but a closure or opening will happen as defined by the interval.

The implementation of the method must be provided. The implementation of the method should check availability and health of all of the resources required to process messages. For example: the application can detect any infrastructure related, database related problems. When the message processing requires a database to be available or any other infrastructure to be alive it is obvious that the processing cannot succeed when the required resource is not accessible.

The method should check availability of all the resources required to process the message. The class may close the channel when the method says that the application is unable to process messages. The method is however only executed when a channel is in the offline, disconnected state or when any errors during the message processing are detected.

A closed channel will only be opened back when the returns true. In other words the channel can only be opened back when the application says that it is ready to process the messages as all the required resources are also ready.

The will close an active and opened channel when any errors during the message processing are detected, when the channel monitoring is turned on and the returns false. E.g. when the throws an exception, the is specified and the application says that it is not ready to process the message by returning false from the .

The intention of the is to keep the channel active always when an application is ready to process messages. When used on the channel is not configured to automatically start when a complete service starts but it is using monitoring and the as the handler the channel can be started anyway by the .
For more details about channel monitoring and configuration check the and classes.

member.name: M:Volvo.NVS.Integration.WindowsServices.Services.ReliableListenerHandler.IsReadyToProcessMessages
member.summary: Determines if the application is capable of processing the messages.

remarks.para: When it is possible for an application to detect any problems resulting in the message processing failures then the application should provide an implementation of this method and return false for problematic cases.

For example: the application can detect any infrastructure related, database problems. When the message processing requires a database to be available or any other infrastructure to be alive it is obvious that the processing cannot succeed when the required resource is not accessible.
The implementation of the method may check availability and health of all of the resources required to process the message.
You may always return true from an implementation of this method when it is not possible to determine if the current state of the application infrastructure is allowing to process the message or not.

The method is only executed when an error with message processing is detected or a channel down time event is raised (a channel is in the offline, disconnected state and a given timeout value is reached). See the interface and the class for details.

member.returns: True if application can process messages and false when any application problems are detected.
